required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation at Rest and Exercise of Clinical, Ultrasonic and Neurohormonal Parameters in Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathies

oversight_info.authority: France:Agence Nationale de Sécurité des Médicaments

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to demonstrate that changes in plasma levels of circulating neurohormones (mainly BNP and NT-proBNP), measured at rest and post-exercise correlate with exercise functional limitation (assessed by exercise peak VO2) and exercise ultrasonic parameters (as left ventricular filling, obstruction, and mitral regurgitation)

detailed_description.textblock: The secondary purposes are to study the kinetics of secretions of natriuretic peptides, and their relationships with extent of MRI myocardial fibrosis with the degree of exercise functional limitation.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Plasmatic Neurohormonal measures: BNP - NT ProBNP - Troponine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at rest and during exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - Age 18 to 75 years
- Primary (sarcomeric) hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, obstructive or non obstructive, with studies of exercise peak oxygen consumption and cardiac MRI with gadolinium late-enhancement
- Informed consent
- Patient with a social insurance Patient at rest
- - Age 18 to 75 years
- Primary (sarcomeric) hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, obstructive or non obstructive
- Informed consent
- Patient with a social insurance
Exclusion Criteria:
- - Insufficient echogenicity
- Permanent atrial fibrillation
- Complete BBB on the ECG
- LVEF < 35 %
- Previous septal ablation (surgical or percutaneous)
- Simultaneous participation to another biomedical research
If exercise needed:
- contraindication to exercise : hemodynamic instability, uncontrolled high blood pressure (>220/120 mmHg), severe aortic stenosis
- Inability to exercise (muscular, pulmonary, elderly patient)
